Content: found, alien server syncs relatively faster with all those indexes are on compared to the first node i waas trying with

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: reindex using single cpu thread atm - thread on alien is probably more powerful than thread on another server

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: if somebody implement multiprocessing reindex/rescan - it should be super fast on alien ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: btw @TonyL , BTC also uses same single thread for reindexing

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it doesn't use multi-thread

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i've done that test recently

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: perhaps there are deep/complicated reasons of such limitation

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if reindex uses multi-thread, some users will always complain that komodo or BTC using all their computational power and other software they are running doesn't work at the same time

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: param like a `nproc` in mining can resolve such complains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: much faster to resync from scratch than reindex addressindex=1

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `./komodod -reindex -j$(nproc)` would be cool for normal reindex ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
**Start nPSV daemon**
`./komodod -nSPV=1 -addnode=94.130.224.11 -addnode=23.254.165.16 &`
**CLI Commands**
```
./komodo-cli nspv_getinfo
./komodo-cli nspv_listunspent address
./komodo-cli nspv_notarizations height
./komodo-cli nspv_hdrsproof prevheight nextheight
./komodo-cli nspv_txproof txid height
./komodo-cli nspv_spentinfo txid vout
./komodo-cli nspv_login wif
./komodo-cli nspv_spend destaddr amount
./komodo-cli nspv_broadcast hex
```
Read more here https://medium.com/@jameslee777/nspv-reference-cli-client-cf1ffdc03631

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -22 usually means non-notarized utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: updated with fixes, hardforking as it also now supports nspv_getinfo <hdrheight> which will return the blockheader for <hdrheight>, default is 0 which means chaintip

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with this, it is possible to track the mainchain as new headers come in (past notarization)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is needed when we start getting more nSPV fullnodes that return different data (they might be syncing, they might be evil)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the recodes are all 0, that means all the utxo are notarized. i think one more rpc call is needed "nspv_validate txid" which will do just the utxo validation that is inside the nspv_spend now. that way, a smarter superlite client can cache validated utxo and not waste time doing it during the spend
